intro: Echinospartum webbii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in summer. Echinospartum webbii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging climates.
